props.description: Protein gel consisting of a molecular sieve or mesh called polyacrylamide that separates SDS-coated proteins by mass. It is “precast”, meaning ready to use. The gel sits between plastic plates with a plastic “comb” protecting the gel wells. The gel is already located in an adapter called a “cassette”. Both together are placed inside the electrophoresis box to run the gel.
The electrophoresis box holds the gel upright and is filled with 1X Running buffer.
Salt-containing buffer to cover the gel and transmit the charge through the protein gel, allowing electrophoresis to occur. Contains 1X Tris-glycine (25 mM Tris, 190 mM glycine) + 0.1% SDS.
P2 micropipette. Used to draw up and dispense volumes of liquid between 0.2 and 2 microliters (µl).
P20 micropipette. Used to draw up and dispense volumes of liquid between 2 and 20 microliters (µl).
P200 micropipette. Used to draw up and dispense volumes of liquid between 20 and 200 microliters (µl).
P1000 micropipette. Used to draw up and dispense volumes of liquid between 200 and 1000 microliters (µl).
Box of P2 tips. Tips are attached to the micropipette and discarded after single use to avoid contamination between transfers.
Box of P20 tips. Tips are attached to the micropipette and discarded after single use to avoid contamination between transfers.
Box of P200 tips. Tips are attached to the micropipette and discarded after single use to avoid contamination between transfers.
Box of P1000 tips. Tips are attached to the micropipette and discarded after single use to avoid contamination between transfers.
Waste container. Used to dispose of any biohazardous waste resulting from the experiment, including micropipette tips.
Motor-driven centrifuge that spins samples at high speed to collect liquid at the bottom of the tube for easy transfer.
Heat block used to incubate samples at a constant temperature, over a long period of time. Has a temperature range from room temperature to 100 degrees Celsius. Also has a timer.
Power supply with red and black cords that must be connected to the connection points on the power supply and the lid of the electrophoresis box.

props.label: 4x SDS Sample Buffer
props.description: Used to prepare protein samples for gel electrophoresis. It needs to be diluted 4x to have the correct final concentration in the sample.

props.label: Wild Type Cell Culture
props.description: Tube containing a culture of wild type, unedited macrophage cells.

props.label: Pancreas Cell Culture
props.description: Tube containing a culture of pancreas cells.

props.label: Edit 4 Cell Culture
props.description: Tube containing CRISPR-edited macrophage cells: Edit 4.

props.label: Edit 7 Cell Culture
props.description: Tube containing another line of CRISPR-edited macrophage cells: Edit 7.

props.label: Wild Type Cells Tube
props.description: Empty tube that will contain wild type, unedited macrophage cells.

props.label: Pancreas Tube
props.description: Empty tube that will contain pancreas cells.

props.label: Edit 4 Tube
props.description: Empty tube that will contain CRISPR-edited macrophage cells: Edit 4.

props.label: Edit 7 Tube
props.description: Empty tube that will contain the second CRISPR-edited macrophage cells: Edit 7.

props.label: Protein Ladder
props.description: A size standard called protein ladder containing pre-stained proteins of the following sizes: 10, 15, 25, 35, 45, 60, 75, 100, 140, and 180 kDa (kilodalton). The proteins appear as blue bands in the protein gel.
These cables connect the power supply to the gel electrophoresis box to enable electricity to flow through the gel.
